p: High-throughput gene expression assays are often used to infer functional relationships between genes from correlations between their expression levels, building the so-called gene co-expression networks ( Figure 1). The potential relevance of this method to estimate GRNs is supported by the knowledge that genes with similar transcriptional expression profiles are likely to be regulated through the same mechanisms and to participate in the same functions, or to physically interact [ 6, 7, 8, 9]. This information can also be combined with other information such as, for example, transcription factor binding and/or PPIs, to obtain a more complete and accurate representation of molecular elementsâ€™ interrelationships [ 10].
